The landscape unfolds before us, a rolling expanse of hills and forests that stretch as far as the eye can see. I feel a sense of freedom, of adventure, as we leave Veresti behind and head into the heart of Transylvania. As the sun begins to set, casting a golden glow over the landscape, the Professor points to a range of mountains in the distance. "The Carpathians," he says, his voice full of awe. The Professor notices my reaction and smiles. "Do not worry," he says. "We will be prepared." But as the darkness gathers, and the shadows grow long and sinister, I cannot shake the feeling that we are being watched, that unblinking eyes are trained on us from the trees.
